intro: Calandrinia portulacifolia, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant red or pink flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, showcasing features like reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. Its flowers are typically small and clustered in dense inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calandrinia portulacifolia is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
